results.title: Women breakout
results.creator_credit: Erika Addis and Halfway House Collective
results.brief_description: This film was made by the Halfway House Collective in Melbourne and is set in Halfway House a feminist refuge. The film does not so much focus on the circumstances that led them to the Halfway House, rather it shows the house giving them support to take control of and change their lives.
results.description: This film was made by the Halfway House Collective in Melbourne and is set in Halfway House a feminist refuge. results.title: Australian vintage
results.creator_credit: Peter Thompson, Australian Wine and Brandy Corporation and Film Australia
results.brief_description: This film explores the development of the wine industry in Australia with particular reference to Australia’s international status as a wine producing country. Features an appearance by winemaker and writer Len Evans.

results.title: Mining in Action
results.creator_credit: Harold Dews, Conzinc Riotinto of Australia and Cinesound Movietone
results.brief_description: Surveys the development of mining operations of Hammersley Iron and Bougainville copper, the lead/zinc operation of the company and the opening of the aluminium smelter at Bluff, New Zealand.

results.title: The Rabies threat
results.creator_credit: Don Murray, Antonio Colacino and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Shows the problems caused by the animal disease rabies, and outlines the work of the Animal Quarantine Service which functions to keep out of Australia all exotic animal diseases.

results.title: The Magic Trumpet
results.creator_credit: Dusan Marek, Eltham Films and Anim-ad Films
results.brief_description: An experimental film using mainly animated paper cut-outs to tell the story of a magic trumpet which brings fame and fortune to an old tramp. Story script by Tim Burstall, music by Michael Kenny and montage, animation and photography by Dusan Marek.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dusan Marek, Eltham Films and Anim-ad Films

results.title: A Continent on guard
results.creator_credit: Peter Johnson, Film Australia and Bob Walker
results.brief_description: Presents a dramatic, simulated investigation into a suspected outbreak of foot and mouth disease in Australia, and points out what measures would be taken to eradicate the disease. Note: A complementary production to ‘The constant threat’

results.title: Land use and abuse
results.creator_credit: John M. Bale, Damien Parer and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Shows the impact of careless land development on the Tasmanian environment and goes on to stress the need for conservationists and developers to work together. Narrated by Stewart Faichney.

results.title: John Davis
results.creator_credit: Bob Weis, Robert Lindsay, National Gallery of Victoria and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Survey (National Gallery of Victoria)”.
Shows the work of Victorian sculptor John Davis, who uses many unusual materials and concepts to create modern sculpture

results.title: Rosalie Gascoigne
results.creator_credit: Robert Lindsay, Judi Stack, Bob Weis, National Gallery of Victoria and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Survey (National Gallery of Victoria)”.
Rosalie Gascoigne talks about her work and interests. She is a self-taught assemblage artist who uses weathered, discarded junk from man-made objects and found objects from nature. Her assemblages create images of domestic country kitchens while her late installations have an outdoor open feeling for country air and light
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Lindsay, Judi Stack, Bob Weis, National Gallery of Victoria and Open Channel Productions

results.title: Robert Rooney
results.creator_credit: Robert Rooney, Judi Stack, Bob Weis, National Gallery of Victoria and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Survey (National Gallery of Victoria)”.
Robert Rooney’s art is a personal analysis of his own life, and in examining his own idiosyncratic behaviour he is exploring the routines and obsessions that concern each and every one of us. These routines are perhaps meaningless to some, yet they consume a major part of our everyday life
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Rooney, Judi Stack, Bob Weis, National Gallery of Victoria and Open Channel Productions
